name: Egg in a Hole
author: rosburn
summary: A delicious runny yolk egg cooked in the center of a piece of toast and eaten with a fork is a great way to enjoy an egg in a slightly different way. My kids feel fancy when eating these.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Melt the bacon grease in a non-stick pan over low heat
Cut a 1 1/2 to 2-inch hole from the center of the bread slice; lay in the hot skillet
When the side facing down is lightly toasted, about 2 minutes, flip and crack the egg into the hole; season with salt and pepper
Continue to cook until the egg is cooked and mostly firm
Flip again and cook 1 minute more to assure doneness on both sides
